bzh.plealog.bioinfo.ui.sequence.event

Interface DDSequenceViewerConn

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CombinedSequenceViewer, CombinedSequenceViewerExt, DDPanelHCA, DSequenceTableViewer

    public interface DDSequenceViewerConn

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<DLocation> getSelectedRanges()
      Returns a list of selected segments over the sequence.
      DSequence getSelectedSequence()
      Returns the selected region of the sequence currently displayed by this viewer.
      int[] getSelectedSequenceRange()
      Returned the global selected region of the sequence displayed in the viewer.
      DSequence getSequence()
      Returns the sequence currently displayed by this viewer.
      void setSelectedSequenceRange(int from, int to)
      Sets the selected region of the sequence displayed in the viewer.
      void setSelectionRanges(List<DLocation> locs)
      Sets a list of selected segments over the sequence.
      void setSequence(DSequence sequence)
      Sets the sequence to be displayed by this viewer.

    • Method Detail

      • setSequence

        void setSequence(DSequence sequence)
        Sets the sequence to be displayed by this viewer. Pass in null to reset the viewer content.

      • getSequence

        DSequence getSequence()
        Returns the sequence currently displayed by this viewer.

      • getSelectedSequence

        DSequence getSelectedSequence()
        Returns the selected region of the sequence currently displayed by this viewer. Returns null if nothing is selected.

      • setSelectedSequenceRange

        void setSelectedSequenceRange(int from,
                            int to)
        Sets the selected region of the sequence displayed in the viewer. Values have to be zero-based and absolute, so use the DSequence DRulerModel to get an absolute position from a sequence coordinate. Set from and to to -1 to reset selection.

      • setSelectionRanges

        void setSelectionRanges(List<DLocation> locs)
        Sets a list of selected segments over the sequence. Value are zero-based and absolute: use the DRulerModel from the DSequence to switch to the sequence coordinate system.

      • getSelectedRanges

        List<DLocation> getSelectedRanges()
        Returns a list of selected segments over the sequence. Value are zero-based and absolute: use the DRulerModel from the DSequence to switch to the sequence coordinate system. Returns null if nothing is selected.

      • getSelectedSequenceRange

        int[] getSelectedSequenceRange()
        Returned the global selected region of the sequence displayed in the viewer. The method returns null if nothing is selected, otherwise the array contains the selected region. Index zero contains from and index one contains to. Values are zero-based and absolute, so use the DSequence DRulerModel to get an from a sequence coordinate from an absolute position.
